name: Prospective Commercial Occupancy Ctl.

market_entry_year_source.notes: Based on BTO target for long-term market introduction (>10 years), updated to current year to avoid retroactive savings effects.

energy_efficiency_source.note: Based on typical relative savings range of 10%-40% (lighting/HVAC) and 50%-90% (PCs)

source_data.title: Energy intelligent buildings based on user activity: A survey
source_data.author: Nguyen et al.

source_data.title: Quantifying National Energy Savings Potential of Lighting Controls in Commercial Buildings
source_data.author: Williams et al.

source_data.title: Reducing Energy Waste for Computers by Human-in-the-Loop Control
source_data.author: Munir et al.

installed_cost_source.notes: Cost analysis for BTO Sensors and Controls proggram; 1 year payback; converted to $/ft^2 floor via `occupant-centered sensing and controls` large office factor in Scout directory ./supporting_data/convert_data/ecm_cost_convert.json

source_data.title: Laying Down the Foundation: An R&D Roadmap for Energy Savings through Advancements in Smart Building Technologies
source_data.author: Sofos et al.
source_data.organization: U.S. Department of Energy Building Technologies Office (BTO)

product_lifetime_source.notes: Assumed limited by lifetime of enabling plug-and-play sensors (see 'Plug-and-Play Sensors (Prospective)' ECM)

_description: Sensing and controls at the zone or sub-zone level to enable accurate, real-time feedback on individual and group-level occupant presence only (not comfort)
